name: Tashilhunpo Monastery
shortDescription: One of the most historically and culturally important monasteries in Tibet
fullDescription: Tashilhunpo Monastery is a historic and culturally important monastery in Shigatse, the second-largest city in Tibet. The monastery was founded in 1447 by the 1st Dalai Lama and is the traditional seat of successive Panchen Lamas.

hotspots.text: Main Prayer Hall - Built in 1447, this is where monks gather for daily prayers
Golden Stupa - Contains relics of past Panchen Lamas

name: Monte Cassino Abbey
shortDescription: Historic Benedictine monastery, mother house of the Benedictine order
fullDescription: The Abbey of Monte Cassino is a rocky hill about 130 kilometres southeast of Rome, in the Latin Valley, Italy. Originally built in AD 529 by Benedict of Nursia, it has been destroyed and rebuilt multiple times throughout history.

hotspots.text: Basilica - Rebuilt after WWII destruction, maintaining original Benedictine architecture
Crypt of St. Benedict - Tomb of the founder of Western monasticism

name: Kanchipuram Temple Complex
shortDescription: Ancient Hindu temple complex and spiritual learning center
fullDescription: Kanchipuram, known as the 'City of Thousand Temples', houses several ancient Hindu temple complexes that have served as centers of spiritual learning and monastic life for over a millennium.

hotspots.text: Main Shrine - Dedicated to Lord Vishnu, carved from single stone block
Meditation Hall - Where monks practice daily meditation and scriptural study
